headerText: The `v-data-table` component is used for displaying tabular data. Features include sorting, searching, pagination, inline-editing, header tooltips, and row selection.

usage.desc: The standard data-table contains data with no additional functionality. You can opt out of displaying table actions that allow you to control the pagination of information with the `hide-actions` prop.

noData.desc: The `no-data` slot can display custom HTML when there's no data.

headers.desc: The `items` and `headers` slots can accept either a collection of <kbd>td/th</kbd> tags, or if you want control of the entire row, a <kbd>tr</kbd> tag.

headerCell.desc: If you only want to apply some common markup or effect on each of the header cells, you can use the slot `headerCell`. In this example is has been used to apply a tooltip to each header.

progress.desc: There is also a `progress` slot for when you want to customize the display for the data table's `loading` state.  By default this is an `indeterminate` `v-progress-linear`

footer.desc: There is also a `footer` slot for when you want to add some extra functionality to tables, for example per column filtering or search.

expand.desc: The `v-data-table` component also supports expandable rows using the `expand` slot. By default expanding a row closes all remaining rows. You can use the prop `expand` on `v-data-table` to prevent expanded rows from closing when clicking on another row.

pageText.desc: You can customize the page text displaying the range and total items by using the `pageText` slot.

select.desc: Selectable rows allow you to perform an action on specific and all rows.

search.desc: The data table exposes a `search` prop that allows you to filter your data.

customIcons.desc: Previous/next pagination icons and sort icon can be customized with **prev-icon**, **next-icon** and **sort-icon** props.

paginate.desc: Pagination can be controlled externally by using the `pagination` prop. Remember that you must apply the `.sync` modifier.

sort.desc: Sorting can also be controlled externally by using the `pagination` prop. Remember that you must apply the `.sync` modifier. You can also use the prop to set the default sorted column.

server.desc: If you're loading data from a backend and want to paginate and sort the results before displaying them, you can use the `total-items` prop. Defining this prop will disable the built-in sorting and pagination, and you will instead need to use the `pagination` prop to listen for changes. Use the `loading` prop to display a progress bar while fetching data.

headerless.desc: You can apply the `hide-headers` and `hide-actions` props to remove the default header and footer respectively.

editdialog.desc: The `v-edit-dialog` component is used for inline-editing within data tables. You can block closing the dialog when clicked outside by adding the **persistent** prop.

crud.desc: data-table with CRUD actions using a `v-dialog` component for editing each row

v-edit-dialog.cancelText: Sets the default text for the cancel button when using the **large** prop
v-edit-dialog.large: Attachs a submit and cancel button to the dialog
v-edit-dialog.saveText: Sets the default text for the save button when using the **large** prop

v-data-table.headers: An array of objects that each describe a header column. See the example below for a definition of all properties
v-data-table.headersLength: Can be used in combination with `hide-headers` to specify the number of columns in the table to allow expansion rows and loading bar to function properly
v-data-table.showSelect: Shows the select checkboxes in both the header and rows (if using default rows)
v-data-table.showExpand: Shows the expand toggle in default rows
v-data-table.showGroupBy: Shows the group by toggle in the header and enables grouped rows
v-data-table.mobileBreakpoint: Used to set when to toggle between regular table and mobile view
v-data-table.height: Set an explicit height of table
v-data-table.caption: Set the caption (using `<caption>`)
v-data-table.headerProps: Pass props to the default header. See 'v-data-table-header' API for more information
v-data-table.calculateWidths: Enables calculation of column widths. `widths` property will be available in select scoped slots
v-data-table.fixedHeader: Fixed header to top of table. **NOTE:** Does not work in IE11

v-data-table.item: Slot to replace the default rendering of a row
v-data-table.item.dataTableSelect: Slot to replace the default `v-checkbox` used when selecting rows
v-data-table.item.dataTableExpand: Slot to replace the default `v-icon` used when expanding rows
v-data-table.body: Slot to replaces the default table `<tbody>`
v-data-table.body.append: Appends elements to the end of the default table `<tbody>`
v-data-table.body.prepend: Prepends elements to the end of the default table `<tbody>`
v-data-table.footer: Slot to add a custom footer
v-data-table.header: Slot to add a custom header
v-data-table.top: Slot to add content above the table
v-data-table.progress: Slot to replace the default `<v-progress-linear>` component
v-data-table.group: Slot to replace the default rendering of grouped rows
v-data-table.group.header: Slot to customize the default rendering of group headers
v-data-table.group.summary: Slot to customize the default rendering of group summaries
v-data-table.item.column.<name>: Slot to customize a specific column

v-edit-dialog.input: Slot used to denote input component for v-edit-dialog

v-edit-dialog.close: Emits when edit-dialog close button is pressed
v-edit-dialog.save: Emits when edit-dialog save button is pressed

v-data-table.update:pagination: Emits when the `pagination.sync` event is updated
